headline.main: 18 or 35 -- Which Makes The Better Soldier; The Army likes to have its soldiers young, but valor, as past and present history tells us, is the proven privilege of every age group

lead_paragraph: THE nation now beckons to young men of 18 and 19 and says. "Come." For two years the question of including them in selective service was gingerly avoided. In hundreds of thousands of homes parents still regarded them as children, entitled to at least a few more sheltered months before becoming involved in the grimmest lottery of the human race.
